info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 9:26PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Garfield and central Rio Blanco Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 925 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Meeker, or 33 miles northwest of Glenwood Springs, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Garfield and central Rio Blanco Counties. This includes Colorado 13 between mile markers 23 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
